import React, { Component } from 'react'; import { Layout, Navigation, Content } from 'react-mdl'; import { Link } from 'react-router-dom'; import Posti from './images/Posti.jpg'; import UWeekendHack from './images/UWeekendHack.jpg'; import GOCAll from './images/GOCAll.jpg'; import UWeekendWin from './images/UWeekendWin.jpg'; import TechAdidas1 from './images/TechAdidas1.png'; import TechAdidas2 from './images/TechAdidas2.png'; import KareVideo from './images/Kare.mp4'; class Resume extends Component { render() { return(

FS Code - Game of Cloud

(Nov 2017, Madrid.)

"A 12-hours hackathon to develop a solution using IBM cloud (Watson) and a Kinect sensor, to bring new software that gets advantage from the two technologies working together.

Capgemini wants to use the latest technology from IBM combined with a Kinect sensor to develop a new idea and technology. The 12-hours FS Code - Game of Cloud hackathon by Capgemini aimed to engage people from universities all around Spain to participate in the development of an innovative idea. The challenge webassemblyjs to develop a functional digital solution for Capgemini clients that uses the IBM cloud and a Kinect.

NED-team, a five students team from the Polytechnic University of Madrid participated together in the event and we won the challenge “1º national place”, we formed a balanced team with computer science backgrounds, experiencing their 2nd hackathon.

The problem

As a first step, we needed to define a problem to solve with our application. As time was limited to 8 hours, we had to move quickly and brainstormed problem statements and find the best solution to implement it.

r

We focused our design and development towards solving the challenge using the Kinect sensor for medicine purpose. After a search on the topic and making some interviews, we end up finding two implementations. The first implementation consists of scanning our skeleton and analyse the information that the Kinect obtains. The second implementation was to use IBM cloud to analyse this data that could be used by the doctor. The goal of the team was to use the Kinect and Watson to bring a new platform that brings a new medical service for the patients.

The solution

The solution we aimed to hack together was a web application called “K-are” that analyse the patient body structure by going through some exercises. To implement this final solution we made use of React, Android studio, IBM cloud, Firebase and Python for the software, and the Konect hardware.

The result within 8 hours was "K-are", a web app that changes the way patients could be treated and interact with the doctor.

My learning

The FS Code - Game of Cloud by Capgemini was my second Hackathon. We learned that it is important to participate in a diverse team of developers and designers and also keep business aspects in mind. As a team, we worked according to our skills and took some time to plan the features and user journey before starting the actual “hacking”. My main role in the team was to manage the team organization, develop the idea, design the interface, develop the front-end and be the responsible to do the pitch. This also helped us come up with a better, more thought-through solution in the end. Our effort was recognised: "K-are" won the first national prize for the IoT category.

Last but not least, I learned how important it is to believe in oneself as a team and keep going even if success seems far away. It may seem difficult to have everything in less than 8 hours– but every team is going through the same struggle and in the end, the extra effort will be worth it.
